block.p: Why must The Times reporters Jere Longman and Christopher Clarey consistently accompany every major accomplishment by a Dutch swimmer with allegations of drug use? Not surprisingly, Longman does not question achievements by United States swimmers such as Misty Hyman's upset victory in the 200-meter butterfly, or Tom Dolan's dominating performance in the 400-meter individual medley. Is it so unreasonable to believe that Pieter van den Hoogenband and Inge de Bruijn are more talented, follow a superior training regimen or, heaven forbid, are just better athletes than the other swimmers.
